ygData.subject: RE: Re: Ideas for Womens Guild
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I agree that this would probably be better.  That way we can make our own rules, etc. ... Wow, that is interesting.  I hadn t noticed. ... The picture of
ygData.messageBody:
>But I do wonder how we will manage a bunch of "Sisters of Love" ;P I
>also have disagreement with how EQ set up the current Sisters from an RP
>angle (well said already), but I don't want to inherit that confusion.
>While I like the structure of the guild proposed ... would it be possible
>to be Sisters of {Something Else}? Then we could set up our own RP angle
>without confusion with an existing NPC order?

I agree that this would probably be better. That way we can make our own rules,

etc.

>As well, the NPC sisters are wood elf warriors who follow
>Erollisi, interestingly not a PC option. And another RP oddity I noticed
>... the Marr twins created Barbarians, and planted "the seed" from which
>humans evolved from Barbarians, however Barbarians cannot worship the
>Marr's, though most humans can.

Wow, that is interesting. I hadn't noticed.

>Tunare is the only other female godess ...

The picture of Quellious looks like a little girl.

>or what do we stand for? Love? Goodness? Comraderie? Valor? >Triumph?

Independence? Strength? Vengeance? Justice? Fate? Creavtivity? (Thinking
of Greek mythology, where the Furies were female and stood for justice and
retribution, the Fates also female, and the Muses female as well. Or we could
be Maenads and represent untamed wildness. Just some ideas of concepts we could

represent.)

>BTW, the chastity thing comes from Roman warrior's beliefs. And it only
>applied to MALES.

On a vaguely related note, I did ponder that perhaps males could serve as
sisters if they underwent castration (also a historical occurence). <evil grin>
What does the race/class mixture look like at this point, anyway?






Melissa
ICQ#23767351
"If Moses had been Pagan, there would have been drummers and dancers around the burning bush."
